revised_title: Exploring the Effects of Heat on Meiosis and the Formation of Diplochromosomes
tldr: This study investigates the impact of high temperatures on meiosis in Fritillaria Meleagris plants. The experiments reveal a new type of derangement where a nucleus at early diplotene changes directly into a pollen-grain resting nucleus. The findings show that heat treatment affects chromosome behavior, leading to the formation of diplochromosomes and various types of abnormal pollen grains.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Epigenetics
